title: Research
text:
My research interests lie in the intersection of statistics and machine learning. I am particularly interested in using causality to achieve robustness and generalizability of statistical models. I care about applications of statistical methodologies in applied science domains such as biology and medical sciences. I enjoy developing software in R and Python.

List of publications and preprints
Huang S, Ailer E, Kilbertus N, Pfister N (2022). “Supervised Learning and Model Analysis with Compositional Data.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2205.07271. doi.
Huang S, Wolkowicz H (2018). “Low-rank matrix completion using nuclear norm minimization and facial reduction.” Journal of Global Optimization, 72(1), 5-26. doi.
El Khatib A, Huang S, Ghodsi A, Karray F (2018). “Nonnegative matrix factorization using autoencoders and exponentiated gradient descent.” In 2018 International Joint Conference on Neural Networks (IJCNN), 1-8. IEEE. doi.

title: Shimeng Huang
text:
Hi, my name is Shimeng Huang. I’m currently a PhD candidate in Statistics at the University of Copenhagen under the supervision of Niklas Pfister and Jonas Peters. I’m a member of the Copenhagen Causality Lab (CoCaLa).

News

title: Biography
text:
Education

PhD in Statistics, University of Copenhagen, Denmark, Sep. 2021 – Aug. 2024 (expected)
MMath in Statistics, University of Waterloo, Canada, Sep. 2017 – Dec. 2018
BMath in Computational Mathematics joint Statistics, University of Waterloo, Canada, Sep. 2016 – June 2017
BA in Mathematical Economics, University of Waterloo, Canada, Sep. 2014 – June 2016



Work

Statistical Programmer & Data Scientist, Hoffmann-La Roche, Canada, Jan. 2019 – June 2021



Languages

English
Mandarin Chinese



Personal background
I was born and raised in Tianjin, China, and my name in Chinese characters is 黄诗萌. In September 2012, I moved to Beijing to start my undergraduate study in Economics at Beijing Jiaotong University. In July 2014, I continued my degree at the University of Waterloo, Canada. After spending some enjoyable years there and in the Greater Toronto Area (specifically Mississauga and Toronto) for study and work, I decided to move to Copenhagen, Denmark, to pursue my PhD degree in September 2021.

title: Software
text:
Python and R packages
Huang S, Ailer E, Pfister N, Kilbertus N (2022). “kernelbiome.” Python package available on PyPI.
Huang S (2021). “rbscCI.” R package available on CRAN.
Huang S, Lysy M (2020). “flexEL.” R package available on GitHub.

Neitmann T, Bundfuss S, Straub B, Kabi S, Miller G, Akinyi T, Smith A, Koukourikou K, Farrugia R, Simms E, Yang A, Koeger R, Shapcott S, Upadhyay O, McGavigan J, Duniec K, G G, Harris A, About M, Kumari P, Carlucci C, Stefonishin D, Mascary S, Zhu Z, Dickinson J, Golab A, Thorpe M, Hodges D, Abercrombie J, Ramirez N, Kumar P, Rahal H, Omnes Y, Ehmann A, Ratford T, Thanikachalam V, Slama O, Huang S, Kim J, Lee S, Denney B, Mubasheer S, Liu W, Kulkarni D, Walkowiak F, Senior T, Morrish J, Howard A, O’Reilly B, Kirkpatrick J, Black J, Khatri L, AG FHR, LLC G (2022). “admiral.” R package available on CRAN.
